channel.title: Easy question to solve..i once knew but now forgot :\ plz look
channel.description:
i once knew how to do everything an was making my servers an stuff...but i've been playen regular rs an forgot since then an heres my question....what do i put in the compile>edit part like if i click on my server an right click compile an click edit what do i put in there? same with runserver? :confused: here r the java files i have so u know what version i use (these r all the folders in my java, what shuld i use an tell me what to type in for edit compile an edit runserver)
j2re1.4.2_03 jdk1.5.0_06 jre1.5.0_06 jre1.5.0_10 jdk1.5.0_05 jre1.5.0_05 jre1.5.0_09 jre1.5.0_11
these are all the folders in my java please help also if u can add me on yahoo or msn or somethin an know how i can get my own server if u know for sure how to walk me through that i will erase everything that ive done so far an listen to u on yahoo or msn or even a reply just i found a super simle 1 before but its gone so i dont remember how to do anytmore (ALSO IM GOOD WITH THESE THINGS SO IT WONT BE HARD TO GUIDE ME THROUGH WITH MAKING MY OWN SERVER THAT I CAN EDIT AN GET ONTO IF U HELP)[br][size=1]Posted on: February 09, 2007, 12:32:03 AM[/size][hr]ALSO MY MSN TO ADD ME IS ahr_az@yahoo.com AND TO ADD ME ON YAHOO ADD ahr_az@yahoo.com

item.title: Easy question to solve..i once knew but now forgot :\ plz look
item.dc:creator: @RS_CHamp2 RS CHamp2
item.description:
@RS_CHamp2 wrote:

Hi,
If I were you i’d try the “perfect compiler”.
It automatically detecs where your javac and java files are and compiles very good. Other than that, it could be that you have a compiler that only works with your sever source so then you need to change this(OR whatever you have):

 javac -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java

TO this: "C:\ProgramFiles\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" -g:none -nowarn -d./Class/ ./Java/*.java

Conclusion: Your computer might have not recongnized the “javac” command all by itself. That normally is caused by not setting the right classpaths(or not at all). To make it easier for you now, I just changed the javac to the path of where the java is installed(this could be different on your computer so edit the path or it wont work). When you did this, and of course dont forget, you have installed the new jdk1.6.0 into c:\whatever you should be able to start&compile your server!
Have fun!

Read full topic
item.source: Easy question to solve..i once knew but now forgot :\ plz look
